page.title: 04WALSGRAVE CHURCHES
page.content: A lot of the local history around our area comes from the two churches.This is because one of them is about 900 years old,the other being 19 years old. Even though they are next to each other they are called different names.One is called the Risen Christ,the other is called St.Mary Magdelene.(St.Mary Magdelene is the oldest.) They have 6 key services each week,3 of these are on Sunday,but there are 4 services on the first Sunday of every month. They both have choir boys and choir girls,more girls than boys,and altogether they have roughly about 20. The church is also used for youth clubs,brownies,guides,cubs and scouts etc,and every day they have something going on. The vicar is Rev.C.A.Bradshaw.
